Deleting Revisions

When you delete a revision, Serena ChangeMan Version Manager removes the revision from the versioned file and its archive. You delete revisions that are no longer needed, to discard unwanted edits, or to remove revisions that will never be required for file restoration. You cannot delete revisions that are associated with promotion groups.

Deleting revisions also deletes the change description that was entered when the revision was checked in.

WARNING: This is a nonrecoverable operation. Once you delete a revision, it cannot be restored.

To delete a revision:

  1. Select the versioned file associated with the revision you want to delete from the File pane. If the Revision pane is displayed, select the revision that you want to delete.

  2. Select one of the following:
    • Actions| Delete Revision to display the Delete Revision from File dialog from which you can select a revision by revision number or version label.
    • File | Delete to skip the Delete Revision from File dialog and display a Confirm Item Deletion message.

  3. Click Yes to the confirmation message or OK in the dialog. This permanently deletes the revision from the archive and the action cannot be undone.
